liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase

liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase:
[legend]

List of all members.

Detailed Description

AbstractDatabase is extended by all supported databases as a facade to the underlying database.

The physical connection can be retrieved from the AbstractDatabase implementation, as well as any database-specific characteristics such as the datatype for "boolean" fields.

Definition at line 32 of file AbstractDatabase.java.

String liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.getColumnType ( String  columnType,
Boolean  autoIncrement 
)

Returns the database-specific datatype for the given column configuration.

This method will convert some generic column types (e.g. boolean, currency) to the correct type for the current database.

Implements liquibase.database.Database.

Reimplemented in liquibase.database.FirebirdDatabase, liquibase.database.MSSQLDatabase, liquibase.database.OracleDatabase, and liquibase.database.PostgresDatabase.

String liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.getDateLiteral ( String  isoDate  ) 

Return a date literal with the same value as a string formatted using ISO 8601.

Note: many databases accept date literals in ISO8601 format with the 'T' replaced with a space. Only databases which do not accept these strings should need to override this method.

Implementation restriction: Currently, only the following subsets of ISO8601 are supported: yyyy-MM-dd hh:mm:ss yyyy-MM-ddThh:mm:ss

Implements liquibase.database.Database.

Reimplemented in liquibase.database.DB2Database, liquibase.database.DerbyDatabase, liquibase.database.HsqlDatabase, and liquibase.database.OracleDatabase.

00314             return "BAD_DATE_FORMAT:" + isoDate;
00315         }
00316     }

void liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.checkDatabaseChangeLogTable (  )  throws JDBCException

This method will check the database ChangeLog table used to keep track of the changes in the file.

If the table does not exist it will create one otherwise it will not do anything besides outputting a log message.

Implements liquibase.database.Database.

void liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.checkDatabaseChangeLogLockTable (  )  throws JDBCException

This method will check the database ChangeLogLock table used to keep track of if a machine is updating the database.

If the table does not exist it will create one otherwise it will not do anything besides outputting a log message.

Implements liquibase.database.Database.

00561             rs = connection.getMetaData().getTables(convertRequestedSchemaToCatalog(getDefaultSchemaName()), convertRequestedSchemaToSchema(getDefaultSchemaName()), getDatabaseChangeLogLockTableName(), new String[]{"TABLE"});

00564                     changeLogLockCreateAttempted = true;

00566 
00567                     getJdbcTemplate().comment("Create Database Lock Table");
00568                     this.getJdbcTemplate().execute(createTableStatement);
00569                     this.commit();
00570                     log.info("Created database lock table with name: " + escapeTableName(getDefaultSchemaName(), getDatabaseChangeLogLockTableName()));
00571                     changeLogLockTableExists = true;
00572                     knowMustInsertIntoLockTable = true;
00573                 }
00574             } else {
00575                 changeLogLockTableExists = true;
00576             }
00577             rs.close();
00578 
00579             if (changeLogLockTableExists) {
00580                 int rows = -1;
00581                 if (!knowMustInsertIntoLockTable) {
00582                     RawSqlStatement selectStatement = new RawSqlStatement("SELECT COUNT(*) FROM " + escapeTableName(getDefaultSchemaName(), getDatabaseChangeLogLockTableName()) + " WHERE ID=1");
00583                     rows = this.getJdbcTemplate().queryForInt(selectStatement);
00584                 }
00585                 if (knowMustInsertIntoLockTable || rows == 0) {
00586                     this.getJdbcTemplate().update(getChangeLogLockInsertSQL());
00587                     this.commit();
00588                     log.info("Inserted lock row into: " + escapeTableName(getDefaultSchemaName(), getDatabaseChangeLogLockTableName()));
00589                     rs.close();
00590                 }
00591             } else {
00592                 throw new JDBCException("Change log lock table does not exist");
00593             }

00595         } catch (SQLException e) {
00596             throw new JDBCException(e);
00597         } finally {

00602                     //noinspection ThrowFromFinallyBlock

String liquibase.database.AbstractDatabase.escapeTableName ( String  schemaName,
String  tableName 
)

Escapes the table name in a database-dependent manner so reserved words can be used as a table name (i.e.

"order"). Currently only escapes MS-SQL because other DBMSs store table names case-sensitively when escaping is used which could confuse end-users. Pass null to schemaName to use the default schema

Implements liquibase.database.Database.

Reimplemented in liquibase.database.MSSQLDatabase.
